Mark Meyer wrote:
> 
> 
> Environment:
> Java, Ant, JUnit, JUnitPerf
> 
> Background:
> We have existing JUnit Test classes.  I have been developing new JUnitPerf
> Tests and TestSuites that leverage existing JUnit Test classes, to simulate
> load, repeat and timed tests.
> 
> We have an automated build system (Cruise Control + Ant) that builds the
> code every 30 seconds.  The builds automatically run the existing JUnit Test
> classes.  However now that I am developing new JUnitPerf classes that
> leverage existing JUnit Test classes - I need a way to "exclude" the running
> of performance or load related Tests from the normal build process.
> 
> Question:
> Is there a way that I can continue to have all of my existing JUnit Test
> classes run automatically (and when needed or desired) flip a switch in a
> properties file or possibly the build.xml file and have the performance
> related tests run?

If you want to run your performance tests on a spearate build schedule 
from your other tests, then you might consider two continuous builds, 
each running different targets. One runs your "all tests" target and the 
other runs your "performance tests only" target. Within each target you 
can select the tests to run as you like.
